column5: I went to take my sons fishing this morning and when we removed our tuneau cover we found our fishing gear had been stolen. Nothing else, just the rods and tackle box...my $500. boat left intact. We went for icecream instead. This afternoon I realized my OutDoor card was in the tackle box. Any idea about what I should do?...Holiday Mondays are hard for contacting government people because the smart ones are out fishing. Any advice is appreciated. Thanks.
Call the MNR asap and see what they can do for ya.  Also if you have an old card around or a copy of your # on the card would help expedite things.
Can't help with the card but, nothings lower than stealing a persons fishing gear except for stealing another person's medicine.  Hope the ice cream was good anyways.  Whopper

Thanks for the link and the advice. I'm getting a replacement card for $9.91, not too bad I guess. I only get out once in while and usually on short notice, so I thought I was smart to have everything together...I think I'll need a new plan. I'll be picking up cheap replacements this week. Thanks again for the quick replies.
